Description: Black-topped red ware pottery bowl made of fine Nile silt with thin walls. Faint diagonal rippling made with a fine comb on exterior walls is obscured by red slip and burnishing in a perpendicular direction to the rippling. The interior is black and highly burnished. Fire clouds are present on rounded base; base worn from use.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s (1937) Black-topped red BR34C, incorrectly described as not rippled. Found with a seemingly undisturbed male (?) in the place of his head, which was missing.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pp. 37-38; pl. 17.34C)
